duties_responsibilities.duty: Execute assigned project activities using established procedures and applying scientific knowledge to manipulate human cell lines, microorganisms, and other biological material.
Perform standard microbiological techniques to culture diverse bacterial isolates under aerobic and anaerobic conditions for banking and delivery to clients.
Maintain and optimize the growth of diverse microbes under various conditions.
Analyze alternative approaches to solve problems or develop new perspectives on existing solutions.
Maintain an effective scientific knowledge base and use broad scientific concepts to resolve problems of moderate scope and complexity.
Summarize experimental results and review conclusions with supervisor/project leader.
Accountable for electronic records management and use of validated systems ensuring information is recorded accurately and consistently.
Perform work according to established internal safety guidelines and procedures, and as specified by appropriate external regulatory agencies.
Participate in routine lab maintenance, lab safety, and compliance implementation.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Molecular Biology, Cellular Biology, or Microbiology or related field and 4+ years of relevant experience (Master’s preferred)
